sensitivityanalysis module¶

sensitivityanalysis.analyze(params, models, fixed_parameters, objective, parameter_bounds={}, mode='np', analysis_type='sobol', N=100)¶

Main algorithm for sensitivity analysis. Wraps analyze_sensitivty and sample_and_integrate.

sensitivityanalysis.analyze_sensitivity(objective_function_values, samples, problems, analysis_type='sobol', **kwargs)¶
sensitivityanalysis.integrate_samples(models, samples, objective, args=())¶
sensitivityanalysis.make_AX1(analysis_result)¶
sensitivityanalysis.make_AX2(analysis_result, keys)¶
sensitivityanalysis.make_default_title(model_num, scenario_num, row_name, func_name)¶
sensitivityanalysis.make_samples(models, params, fixed_parameters, parameter_bounds, analysis_type='sobol', N=1000)¶
sensitivityanalysis.make_samples_for_row(row, model, fixed_parameters, parameter_bounds={}, analysis_type='sobol', N=1000, **kwargs)¶

Supporting function for sample_and_integrate. Do not run. row must be a pandas Series

sensitivityanalysis.plot_first_order(analysis_result, problems={}, titles={}, analysis_type='sobol', figs=None, AX=None, analysis_keys=(), **heatmap_args)¶

If analysis_type is neither sobol, fast nor delta, use analysis_keys to specify which keys/columns to use.

sensitivityanalysis.plot_second_order(analysis_result, problems={}, titles={}, analysis_type='sobol', figs=None, AX=None, analysis_keys=(), **heatmap_args)¶

If analysis_type is not sobol, use analysis_keys to specify which keys/columns to use.

sensitivityanalysis.salib_wrapper(problem, y_val, x, analysis_type='sobol', **kwargs)¶

Backend wrapper for sobol, fast and delta analysis.
